Maybe it gave a bit too much "room"so to speak for that womans puukko thing but when they were fighting  in trenches there was a lot of hand to hand combat. Of course "puukko" was just one tool one could use, more propably soldier used his rifle to hit enemy in a situation like that.

The whole "puukko" thing is just a american (and elsewhere too) stereotype about every finnishman having one in his pocket all the time. Urban legend like all finnish people are born in sauna etc.
